meanings.definition: A play, movie, or broadcast program intended to make an audience laugh.
meanings.sent1: The comedy we watched last night had us all laughing.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy watching comedy shows with my friends.
meanings.sent3: The comedy about a clumsy detective was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: Life is like a comedy, full of unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The comedy performance was so funny that I couldn't stop laughing.

meanings.definition: The genre of dramatic literature dealing with the comic or with the serious in a light or satirical manner.
meanings.sent1: Shakespeare's comedies are known for their witty dialogues.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the complexity of comedy in literature.
meanings.sent3: The comedy of errors in the play made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: In the world of literature, comedy often mirrors real-life absurdities.
meanings.sent5: The comedy in the novel added a touch of lightheartedness to the story.

meanings.definition: A humorous or amusing aspect of life.
meanings.sent1: Finding joy in simple things is a form of comedy in everyday life.
meanings.sent2: We all need a bit of comedy to brighten our days.
meanings.sent3: The comedy of a cat chasing its tail never gets old.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes, the comedy of life lies in its unpredictability.
meanings.sent5: The comedy of human interactions can be both heartwarming and funny.
